website_summaries.verdict: The Boston Acoustics Duo-i Plus is a great-sounding AM/FM/iPod clock radio with plenty of customization and connectivity options.
pros: Great-sounding AM/FM dual alarm clock with iPod/iPhone playback
cons: May be too large for crowded nightstands

customer_reviews.title: Not bad...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a lark and I don't regret it. I'm no aficionado, but it sounds good to me. I wish it would play CDs, which it doens't, and it's a little big for my nightstand, but overall OK. I'm also worried about compatibility issues if/when I get a new portable music device. I don't use any functions besides the radio, clock, and iPHone playback. It's got a new alarm thing but I haven't really tried to use it
customer_reviews.author: Record Heat

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff speakers
customer_reviews.text: I love my speakers...they have good hi's and lows, while maintaining good clarity...beautiful, black and shiny speakers...speaker area is covered with a strong metal like material...easy to operate, but heavy and hard to carry room to room...
customer_reviews.author: readaholic

customer_reviews.title: More than pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Have been high on Boston for years. Knew this product was discontinued. So pleased it was located, purchased and received. Had a chance for a test-listen before giving it away. It is every bit as awesome as I expected. Am going to order one for ME. Can't give a higher recommendation than that. But with a limited remaining supply, why?
customer_reviews.author: doug barns

customer_reviews.title: All I Expected
customer_reviews.text: I wanted good speakers for my ipod and my laptop when I play DVDs. Bose and Klipsch both sound good, but no better that the Boston Acoustics Duo and the Duo has a clock radio and lots of other features like a front input for non-ipod sources. The duo looks sharp and has a pretty blue dimming clock. It's all I wanted; all in one!
customer_reviews.author: J. H. Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Large Sound from a Small Package
customer_reviews.text: This unit, in my opinion, was smaller than I expected. Which for me is a plus. Overall the construction is solid, the controls simple, and the sound is impressive. The ported speaker design really delivers a throaty bass response. I had a piece of paper behind the unit when I first cranked it up and it literally blew the paper away! It manages to deliver the bass while maintaining a fairly natural balanced sound. I would definitely recommend this unit over the comparable Bose product.
customer_reviews.author: Ben M. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect way for me to wake up!
customer_reviews.text: Spectacular piece of technology. Great easy snooze method, accepts ipod, easy presets, looks cool. only prob is a little bright when sleeping and if you dim, it's hard to adjust settings if necessary. But that's minor compared to the great sound and easy controls..... at a great price compared to similar models.
customer_reviews.author: Mickomite

customer_reviews.title: Super!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Boston Acoustic product. I pre-ordered this Duo-I-Plus because of the iPhone function. My friend has a BOSE and he even thinks the sound is better than his. Just can not say enough about this product..
customer_reviews.author: James D. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding unit
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm happy with my purchase of the Boston Acoustics Duo-I Plus. The only things I don't like are the long white antena wire on the rear of the unit, wish it was placed internally somehow. Also the black model I choose is a dust magnet. Other than that, I love it! Great sound, and I love the way it automatically dims itself when the lights go off. I would recomend this product.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Unless you're a Bose snob, this radio is great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this radio for myself several years ago, when I balked at the price of similar Bose stereos - Let me just say, that I'm glad I didn't pull the trigger on the Bose stereo! This does everything that I could ever want a portable boom box with iphone dock to do! Every time I turn it on, I can't believe the depth and range of sound that comes out of this little box! I ended up buying one for my parents after I showed it to them - it made a great Christmas present for them, and they still use it all the time. Bottom Line: Great value, great product.
customer_reviews.author: NetGen

customer_reviews.title: A pleasing gift
customer_reviews.text: We gave this unit to our son and daughter-in-law for Christmas. We rejected a cheaper radio with i-pod dock after seeing negative reviews, and have always had a positive image of Boston Acoustics products. We got rave reviews from them. Perfect size for their kitchen space, great sound quality, easy to use and they like the HD stations. We might buy one ourselves to replace our ugly clunker of a radio.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: I own a Bose ipod dock. This product sounds better at less the price! I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Desert lover

customer_reviews.title: Too big!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for a friend, he is happy with the sound but I believe that this unit is SO BIG for the sound, it looks like a giant brick, sounds good but just TOO BIG!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia H.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: I read a bunch of reviews, and against my better judgment I bought this for my husband because he said the company has a good reputation. Let me tell you, they won't for long. Hubby opened his Christmas present, plugged it in, and.... nothing. I returned it and bought a Tivoli Songbook. Don't be a foo' like me. Read the reviews and DO NOT BUY THIS.
customer_reviews.author: KaFou

customer_reviews.title: FIVE STARS PLUS !!!
customer_reviews.text: SIMPLE STYLING,SIMPLE SETTINGS, SOUND REPRODUCTION COMPARES OR BETTER THAN BOSE AT HALF THE PRICE!!! Simply THE BEST TOP OF THE LINE CLOCK RADIO EVER MADE. THANK YOU AMAZON FOR HOOKING ME UP WITH THIS GREAT PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: bill poppin jr.

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!! We have had it now for just over a year and have to return it twice; we have sent it back for repairs twice and now that the warranty has expired it has developed a new problem with its alarm system. Long story short: this is NOT a reliable product. For this money it should work flawlessly instead of screwing up constantly.
customer_reviews.author: donebylee

customer_reviews.title: Poor
customer_reviews.text: Item looks great and the radio sounds great, but the iPod/charging portion of the unit is terrible. Sound goes fuzzy after about 15 seconds of charging.
customer_reviews.author: Roy rogers

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Run don’t walk away from this product. Every time there is a storm it stops working and has to be returned to be reset. Piece of junk that I threw in the trash after 18 months of frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Wrong Way Bill

customer_reviews.title: Big? Yes, both in Size and Sound
customer_reviews.text: This unit is large but puts out room-filling sound. The bass is intense but you can adjust it to your liking. As other reviewers have stated, there is a gentle buzzing sound when the unit is charging your iPod. It's especially noticeable when not playing music and the power is switched on. Yes, the display is very bright even at the dimmest setting. I cover mine at night. Thought of applying a layer of dark tint. The favorable features are: dual alarm clock, very easy time and settings changes with smooth tactile feel on the knobs, great sound, snooze by touching any part of the metal trim, remote control with magnet, composite video output and an attractive unit.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but not by your bed
customer_reviews.text: I agree with most reviews, this is a solid unit with a great sound. But be aware of a very low buzzing noise. If you intend to have this unit by your bed and your room is quiet you'll hear a constant low frequency (very disturbing) noise. I've contact the manufacture and they've told me it was normal, part of the transformer. In my case this was not OK and I removed the unit form my bedroom. Now in another area the noise is not noticeable and the everybody likes it and comment on how good and full the sound is. So, if you don't want to use it by your bed I'll say it's fine piece of electronic.
customer_reviews.author: A. D. da Silva

customer_reviews.title: i loved the sound quality
customer_reviews.text: well my boston acoustics duo-i finally gave up the ghost... same problems as others have noted... won't turn on... loud crackling and popping. volume stops working... gets hot.. . all this after 5 years of service... i loved the sound quality... it's just too bad this unit didn't last longer... i've had less expensive radios last a lot longer... buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Forrest

customer_reviews.title: solid and great sound
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this unit for 3 years. We own a JBL and an Altec as well, but our two different Boston Acoustics are superior by far. The sound fills the room fully; it's not tinny. We haven't experienced any problems on low volume that some reviewers have mentioned. I'm about to order another docking system for a bedroom. I appreciate that its radio is digital, not analog. I'm not rating this particular unit 5 stars simply because the one settings button annoys me a bit, as it controls so many different functions.
customer_reviews.author: Oliveoyl

customer_reviews.title: Junk! Mine and two friends also Junk
customer_reviews.text: this radio worked great for about eight months, great sounding radio great looking radio. not the best function layout, but not horrible too bright even on the lowest setting, but all in all it WAS a good sounding radio Until after about eight months it started to act up, the it failed all together it wouldn't shut off and it wouldn't hold a station, it was toast at the same time my buddies radio, which he bought on my recommendation bit the dust, then after that , i heard from yet another friend that his Boston Acoustics failed twice until he gave up on it all together obviously BA has issues never again
customer_reviews.author: R. Ruttan

customer_reviews.title: No wonder it's discontinued.
customer_reviews.text: Sent the first one back because it didn't work. The second one had the best sound, loved it, but that's all in the past, because didn't last. Sounded better than a BOSE on the table but it no longer goes on, it's not able. What a sad waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Ken H.

customer_reviews.title: Unit failed prematurely
customer_reviews.text: I would NOT recommend this product. The Horizon Duo-i sounds great, looks great, and has a lot of features. Unfortunately, the whole unit failed: the sound doesn't shut off (you have to unplug it), the tuner stopped working, the other controls stopped functioning right. It seems to be a failure of the "mother board" or the radio equivalent. When I called Boston Acoustics, they would not offer any help since it is out of warrantee. For a product of this price, I think the manufacturer should back up their products better....not hide behind a specific warrantee period. Basically, I have to throw it out even though it is a $300 clock radio, much costlier than others on the market.
customer_reviews.author: VT Scooper

customer_reviews.title: Boston Acoustics reliability sucks
customer_reviews.text: Have to agree with the others that the reliability of this unit ruins what otherwise would be a decent stereo. Once the warranty is up (12 months New), this thing is a doorstop. On mine, the iPhone/iPod connector stopped working--Boston wanted me to pay $150 for the repair plus shipping and handling to a service center in Los Angeles. Absurd. I hate companies that once they have your money don't give a damn about you. Boston Acoustics is the definition of this type of company. I have a soundbar, a clock radio, and this from Boston--and won't be buying more if they won't stand behind their products better.
customer_reviews.author: tomjonesrocks

customer_reviews.title: Wow, what an improvement from the iHome
customer_reviews.text: After 4 crappy years of dealing with the iHome this baby came to my house thanks to some coupons and it sounds great. The set up is kindergarten level and took 5 minutes. The sound is phenomenal. The iPhone link is perfect. Major quality of life improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Ritzman

customer_reviews.title: I don't regret buying it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 4 years now. Sound is still great, love the dual alarms (I leave one set to my standard wakeup time and set the other as needed). The only real downside is that if I dock my iPod, the connection gets very hot. Whenever I use it with an iPod, I undock once I'm done.
customer_reviews.author: R. Charbonneau

customer_reviews.title: Boston Acoustics Trash
customer_reviews.text: TRASH! Buggy firmware. Sent the unit back for firmware updating once when the time advanced by 6 minutes for every 20 minutes the alarm played. Now, I discovered when the "beep" alarm sounds, it resets the stereo volume to "0" ... not much point in having a 2-alarm system, not to mention that you won't wake-up the next day either (because the alarm sounds but the volume is "0". And as if that's not enough, the system shuts-down about 5 minutes into playing an ipod. STAY AWAY FROM BOSTON ACOUSTICS!
customer_reviews.author: R. Seifert

customer_reviews.title: Died Upon Warranty Expiration
customer_reviews.text: I owned it and loved it at first but the unit developed a small buzz sound at low volume. The unit also died right after the warranty expired and the company REFUSED to do anything! Not good customer relations, especially after buying their products for 40+ years (Marantz, McIntosh, Denon, etc.). I will NEVER buy their goods again.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Zumbo

customer_reviews.title: Good And Bad
customer_reviews.text: This item has good and bad things about it. Here are some of the good things. - Great sound (turn bass down to -5 for best sound quality.) - Ability to control iphone/ ipod touch Bad things: -big -heavy -bright screen -limited warranty Tips: -turn bass down to -5 for best sound quality. -set the dock so while playing music, it shows the clock (time) I don't write many reviews, so enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Sam Mendelson

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE.
customer_reviews.text: STOPPED WORKING AFTER A YEAR. Literally right after the warranty expired. DO NOT BUY. Waste of your money.Utterly disappointed with company as well.
customer_reviews.author: M Powell

product_meta.title: Boston Acoustics Duo-I Plus IPhone/IPod Dock AM/FM Stereo Radio and Clock Functions (Gloss Black) (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description: The Duo I Plus is an iPhone/iPod Dock with AM/FM Stereo Radio and clock functions. Option 1: listen to your favorite music and playlists while you charge your iPhone/iPod. Option 2: enjoy noise free reception of even distant radio stations. The versatile Duo i plus offers big system sound that fits virtually anywhere — your family room, kitchen, office, or all of these and more. With dual alarms and Boston’s 360 degree snooze Bar, Duo i plus also makes a great bedside radio — and you can be sure of waking up to the music that gets you going. The unique shape of Duo i plus is one key to its exceptional performance. Left and right full range speakers are isolated from each other in separate acoustic chambers for rich, distinct stereo sound. Another key is proprietary Bass Trac audio processing for clean bass at all listening levels. The two technologies work together to deliver stunningly realistic reproduction of your favorite music — in any genre, anywhere.
feature_bullets: Works with iPhone & Made for iPod
Integrated iPod dock with video output charges your iPod or iPhone
Dual high performance 3½ inch full range speakers
BassTrac audio processing for clean bass at all listening levels

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.9 out of 5 stars63 ratings2.9 out of 5 stars
specifications.Best Sellers Rank: #632 in MP3 Player & Cell Phone Audio Docks#1,516 in Clock Radios
